Emacs or Vi/Vim are both good choices for writing code
I prefer vim, but as mwe pointed out it is a personal preference
(i installed ubuntu about 8 hours ago, so i'm a bit new =))
or to cut to the chase type 'vim'
That is the learning curve part
It does, you need to se up your .vimrc file
just for the record, i am a total n00b regarding anything ubuntu does
from a terminal type the following 'vim ~/.vimrc'
When vim loads press 'i' to insert
Type or paste the options you want
Then hit the escape key and type ':wq!'
Those setting will now be loaded everytime you start vim
w for saving, q for quit
so i'm removing the comments now

Vim is different in that it is modal
Meaning you are either in edit or read only mode
It is tough to get used to but some people seems to like it
